metadata.Title: CVE-2021-42717 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description: ModSecurity 3.x through 3.0.5 mishandles excessively nested JSON objects. Crafted JSON objects with nesting tens-of-thousands deep could result in the web server being unable to service legitimate requests. Even a moderately large (e.g., 300KB) HTTP request can occupy one of the limited NGINX worker processes for minutes and consume almost all of the available CPU on the machine. Modsecurity 2 is similarly vulnerable: the affected versions include 2.8.0 through 2.9.4.

criterions.comment: modsecurity-apache: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
